Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Retrolaminar Block and Serratus Anterior Plane Block for Postoperative Analgesia in Radical Mastectomy

Trial_Design.evidence: This prospective, randomised controlled trial included 70 patients undergoing radical mastectomy.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to receive either ultrasound-guided RLB or SAPB.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the visual analogue scale (VAS) score during coughing at 6 hours postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 35 patients were randomised to each group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The median VAS scores during coughing at 6 hours postoperatively were 2 (IQR: 1-3) in both groups, with no significant difference (P = 0.39).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar between groups.
